Haoliang Jiang (Haulyang Jyang)

Master's Student
College of Computing
Georgia Institute of Technology

Email: hjiang321@gatech.edu
Google Scholar   GitHub

About Me

I am a master's student, studying in a Master of Science in Computer Science program at Georgia Tech. I have a wide interest in AI, robotics, computer vision and design.

Earlier, I earned my Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University in 2019. I worked as a graduate research assistant on AI for design in Visaul Design and Engineering Lab (VDEL). I worked closely with Prof. Levent Burak Kara, Prof. Zhenguo Nie and Prof. Amir Barati Farimani.

Prior to my graduate study, I graduated from Shanghai High School and received my Bachelor's degree in Vehicle Engineering from Tongji University in 2017 . In 2016 summer, I was a visiting research intern in Combustion Modeling Lab, U.C.Berkeley working with Prof. Jyh-Yuan Chen.

Other than that, I have also enjoyed my time at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and at University of California at Los Angeles during undergraduate exchanging programs.

Curriculum vitae.

Publications

StressGAN: A Generative Deep Learning Method for 2D Stress Distribution Prediction
Haoliang Jiang , Zhenguo Nie, Roselyn Yeo, Amir Barati Farimani and Levent Burak Kara
Journal of Applied Mechanics (Impact Factor: 2.671), 2021
Preprint   Paper   GitHub

TopologyGAN: Topology Optimization Using Generative Adversarial Networks Based on Physical Fields Over the Initial Domain
Zhenguo Nie, Tong Lin, Haoliang Jiang and Levent Burak Kara
Journal of Mechanical Design (Impact Factor: 2.652), 2021
Preprint   Paper

Stress Field Prediction in Cantilevered Structures using Convolutional Neural Networks
Zhenguo Nie, Haoliang Jiang and Levent Burak Kara
Journal of Computing and Information Science in Engineering (Impact Factor: 1.431), 2020
Preprint   Paper

Data-driven Upsampling of Point Clouds
Wentai Zhang, Haoliang Jiang, Zhangsihao Yang, Soji Yamakawa, Kenji Shimada and Levent Burak Kara
Computer-Aided Design (5-Year Impact Factor: 3.541), 2019
Preprint   Paper

3D Shape Synthesis for Conceptual Design and Optimization using Variational Autoencoders
entai Zhang, Zhangsihao Yang, Haoliang Jiang, Suyash Nigam, Soji Yamakawa, Tomotake Furuhata, Kenji Shimada and Levent Burak Kara
International Design Engineering Technical Conferences & Computers and Information in Engineering Conference 2019
preprint   Paper

Research

Robotic Perception and Learning Lab, Georgia Tech

Visual Design and Engineering Lab, CMU

Data-driven Upsampling of Point Clouds (Mar.-July 2018)
Visual Design and Engineering Lab, CMU

Visual Design and Engineering Lab, CMU

Autoignition Characteristics of Jet Fuels, Biodiesels and PRFs (Jul.-Oct.2016)
Combustion Modeling Lab, U.C.Berkeley
